data.name: AvoidCallingProblematicMethodsDescription
data.value: A member calls a potentially dangerous or problematic method.

data.name: AvoidCallingProblematicMethodsMessageSystemGCCollect
data.value: Remove the call to GC.Collect from {0}. It is usually unnecessary to force garbage collection, and doing so can severely degrade performance.

data.name: AvoidCallingProblematicMethodsMessageSystemThreadingThreadResume
data.value: Remove the call to Thread.Resume from {0}. Suspending and resuming threads can be dangerous if the system is in the middle of a critical operation such as executing a class constructor of an important system type or resolving security for a shared assembly.

data.name: AvoidCallingProblematicMethodsMessageSystemThreadingThreadSuspend
data.value: Remove the call to Thread.Suspend from {0}. Suspending and resuming threads can be dangerous if the system is in the middle of a critical operation such as executing a class constructor of an important system type or resolving security for a shared assembly.

data.name: AvoidCallingProblematicMethodsMessageSystemTypeInvokeMember
data.value: Remove the call to System.Type.InvokeMember with BindingFlags.NonPublic from {0}. Taking a dependency on a private member increases the chance of a breaking change in the future.

data.name: AvoidCallingProblematicMethodsMessageCoInitializeSecurity
data.value: {0} is a P/Invoke declaration to an OLE32 API that cannot be reliably called after the runtime has been initialized. The workaround is to write an unmanaged shim that will call the routine and then activate and call into managed code. You can do this using an export from a mixed-mode C++ DLL, by registering a managed component for use by COM, or by using the runtime hosting API.

data.name: AvoidCallingProblematicMethodsMessageCoSetProxyBlanket
data.value: {0} is a P/Invoke declaration to an OLE32 API that cannot be reliably called against a runtime callable wrapper (a managed object wrapping a COM object). Runtime callable wrappers dynamically fetch interface pointers so the effect of the call might be arbitrarily lost. Runtime callable wrappers for a given COM object are also shared across an application domain so the call could possibly affect other users. Replace this call with a native wrapper COM object for the interface pointer that does the appropriate CoSetProxyBlanket calls.

data.name: AvoidCallingProblematicMethodsMessageSystemRuntimeInteropServicesSafeHandleDangerousGetHandle
data.value: Remove the call to SafeHandle.DangerousGetHandle from {0}.

data.name: AvoidCallingProblematicMethodsMessageSystemReflectionAssemblyLoadFrom
data.value: Remove the call to Assembly.LoadFrom from {0}.

data.name: AvoidCallingProblematicMethodsMessageSystemReflectionAssemblyLoadFile
data.value: Remove the call to Assembly.LoadFile from {0}.

data.name: AvoidCallingProblematicMethodsMessageSystemReflectionAssemblyLoadWithPartialName
data.value: Remove the call to Assembly.LoadWithPartialName from {0}.
